questions.question:
Procedure for conducting sand replacement method is of the order.
(I) Place the cylinder over the tray.
(I) Place the tray over the ground.
(III) Dug the test hole.
(IV) Open the cylinder valve.

explanations.a: This option is not in order where the cylinder is placed over the tray in the first step.
explanations.b: This option is in the correct order where the tray is placed over the ground in the first step, then a test hole is dug ,then place the cylinder over the tray and open the cylinder valve.
explanations.c: This option is not in order where the test hole is dug in the first step. Tray has to be placed on the ground in the first step.
explanations.d: This option is not in order where the first step is correct. In the second step a hole is dug for the test, which is incorrect.

questions.question: If the mass of the soil sample is 1500g and the volume of the container is 1000cm<sup>3</sup>, the density of the sample in g/cm<sup>3</sup> is______

explanations.a: The answer is wrong. Formula to calculate density = mass/volume.
explanations.b: Formula to calculate density = mass/volume = 1500/ 1000 = 1.5g/cm<sup>3</sup>. Hence correct.
explanations.c: The answer is wrong. Formula to calculate density = mass/volume.
explanations.d: The answer is wrong. Formula to calculate density = mass/volume.

questions.question: The principle used in the method of Submerged mass density is ________________.

explanations.a: A floating body is said to be in equilibrium condition, if the body returns back to its original condition after applying angular displacement.
explanations.b: The force that retards the moving sphere through a viscous fluid is directly proportional to the velocity, radius of the sphere and viscosity.
explanations.c: This principle states that the upward buoyant force that is exerted on a body immersed in a fluid, is equal to the weight of the fluid that the body displaces.
explanations.d: The rate of flow of liquid through a soil  medium of unit cross sectional area is directly proportional  to hydraulic gradient.

questions.question: Calibration of the cylinder is carried out by ______.

explanations.a: Gravel cannot be used for calibrating the cylinder, since it can not pass through the calibration cylinder.
explanations.b: Sand is used for calibration of cylinders.
explanations.c: Soil cannot be used for calibration of cylinders.
explanations.d: Silt cannot be used for calibration of cylinders.

questions.question: Internal diameter of calibrating container is ________.

explanations.b: Wrong answer. Internal diameter of the calibrating container is not 20cm.
explanations.c: Wrong answer. Internal diameter of the calibrating container is not 40cm.
explanations.d: Wrong answer. Internal diameter of the calibrating container is not 40cm.
